result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven William Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven William Arndt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven William Arndt was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus costs.  To be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample unless previously done, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No use of illegal substances.
No driving of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Take any and all prescribed medications as prescribed.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Release privileges for AODA treatment, medical treatment and spousal support.  Court remains silent as to the issue of defendant being allowed to have electronic monitoring.
**11/3/2014  Huber release for family care granted.
***3/6/2015  defendant granted good time credit.

Contacted Atty. Rothstein about the paperwork from the agent;  on 1/21/16, he informed the court that the agent is not submitting the paperwork and that no further action will be necessary at this time.
Motion filed without further action.  jbs
Letter to Attorney Rothstein seeking additional paperwork from agent (Form CR-284).
Notice of Motion and Motion to Terminate Probation
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant is granted good time credit on his condition time pursuant to Sec. 302.43 and 973.09(1)(d); signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
POST-JUDGMENT MOTION received.
Upon all the records, filings ,and proceedings had herein, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant, Steven W. Arndt, is granted Huber release for family care - signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's request for family care (vs. spousal support).
Green form not in file.

Defendant Steven William Arndt in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to the sentencing documents. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 44 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 20 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS. 
Credit given for 4 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendan is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 9 MONTHS "condition time" with release privileges for AODA treatment, medical treatment, and spousal support.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS COSTS - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Take any and all prescribed medications as prescribed.
* No use of illegal substances.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are revoked for a period of 3 years.
* No driving of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 2 years.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
* Court remains silent as to the issue of defendant being allowed to have electronic monitoring with the condition time.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report.

Defendant Steven William Arndt in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed outright.
